description:
## Overview
[github.com/helm/helm/pkg/chartutil](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/helm/helm/pkg/chartutil) is a package manager for kubernetes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. There is a bug in which the `alias` field on a `Chart.yaml` is not properly sanitized. This could lead to the injection of unwanted information into a chart.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/helm/helm/pkg/chartutil` to version 2.16.11, 3.3.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/helm/helm/security/advisories/GHSA-9vp5-m38w-j776)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/6aab63765f99050b115f0aec3d6350c85e8da946)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/e7c281564d8306e1dcf8023d97f972449ad74850)
title: Improper Input Validation

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE).

### PoC
1. Create a malicious program and rename it to git.exe push commit to a repo.
2. Now run talisman with `--scan` or `--githook pre-commit`
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/thoughtworks/talisman` to version 1.4.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/thoughtworks/talisman/issues/216#issuecomment-669717822)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/thoughtworks/talisman/commit/b821169359bf96c6923e00732e68ec44e62949c1)
title: Remote Code Execution (RCE)

description:
## Overview
[gopkg.in/square/go-jose.v1](https://godoc.org/gopkg.in/square/go-jose.v1) is a Package that aims to provide an implementation of the Javascript Object Signing and Encryption set of standards.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Elliptic Curve Key Disclosure. It suffers from an invalid curve attack for the ECDH-ES algorithm. When deriving a shared key using ECDH-ES for an encrypted message, go-jose neglected to check that the received public key on a message is on the same curve as the static private key of the receiver, thus making it vulnerable to an invalid curve attack.
## Remediation
Upgrade `gopkg.in/square/go-jose.v1` to version 1.0.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/square/go-jose/commit/c7581939a3656bb65e89d64da0a52364a33d2507)
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/164590)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/03/1)
title: Elliptic Curve Key Disclosure

description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/vault/vault](https://www.vaultproject.io/) is a tool for securely accessing secrets.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Authentication Bypass. When using the IAM AWS Auth Method, under certain circumstances, values Vault uses to validate identities and roles can be manipulated and bypassed.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/vault/vault` to version 1.2.5, 1.3.8, 1.4.4, 1.5.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#151)
title: Authentication Bypass

description:
## Overview
[github.com/go-gitea/gitea](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea) is a self-hosted git service.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). An attacker can trigger a deadlock by initiating a transfer of a repositorys ownership from one organization to another.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/go-gitea/gitea` to version 1.12.0-rc1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/10549)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/11438)
- [PoC Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmVgADSVS88)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/nanobox-io/golang-nanoauth](https://github.com/nanobox-io/golang-nanoauth) is a library that provides a uniform means of serving HTTP/S for golang projects securely.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Timing Attack during auth token validation.
## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/nanobox-io/golang-nanoauth/pull/5)
title: Timing Attack

description:
## Overview
[github.com/gravitational/teleport/lib/web](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport) is a Privileged access management tool.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Timing Attack via `apiserver.go`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gravitational/teleport/lib/web` to version 2.7.8, 3.0.4, 3.1.3 or higher.
## References
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/commit/ee4eba392e58fe38def6eff75d98894fdfac3282)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/pull/2482)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#313)
title: Timing Attack

description:
## Overview
[github.com/ulikunitz/xz](https://github.com/ulikunitz/xz) is a package for reading and writing of xz compressed streams.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). It is possible create an infinite read loop due to the usage of the `ReadUvarint` and `ReadVarint` function when encoding/binary via invalid inputs.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/ulikunitz/xz` to version 0.5.8 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/ulikunitz/xz/commit/69c6093c7b2397b923acf82cb378f55ab2652b9b)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/miekg/dns](https://github.com/miekg/dns) is a complete and usable DNS library.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insecure Randomness. It improperly generates random numbers because math/rand is used. The `TXID` becomes predictable, leading to response forgeries.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/miekg/dns` to version 1.1.25 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/miekg/dns/commit/8ebf2e419df7857ac8919baa05248789a8ffbf33)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/miekg/dns/issues/1043)
title: Insecure Randomness

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Output Neutralization for Logs. Secret leaks in kube-controller-manager when using vSphere Provider
## Remediation
Upgrade `k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/vsphere` to version 1.20.0-alpha.2 or higher.
## References
- [Announcement](https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-announce/c/ScdmyORnPDk)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/95236/commits/247f6dd09299bc7893c1e0affea11c0255025b96)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95621)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/95236)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1886635)
title: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs
